channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Implementation Shortfalls Hamstring Factor Strategies
item.description: Smart rebalancing rules help portfolio managers capture more of the return that is inherent in their factor strategies. Concentrating on “priority best” trading improves factor portfolio performance.

item.title: Californians are sick of the 'malaise that's plagued' the state, says CEO who plans to build new city in the Bay Area—and he's submitted 20,000 signatures to prove it
item.description: The Silicon Valley-backed campaign to build a green city in the San Francisco Bay Area has submitted what it says are enough signatures to qualify for the November election.

item.title: IFRS Accounting Standard Will Support Better Investment Decisions
item.description: IFRS 18 responds to investors' concerns about challenges in comparing companies' financial performance.

item.title: Deliveroo driver bit off customer's thumb—now U.K. government cracks down on account sharing
item.description: Delivery platforms will carry out enhanced checks on riders, as substitute rider Jennifer Roche faces a prison sentence for attacking a customer.

item.title: Meir Statman: Your State of Mind Influences Your Investing Success
item.description: Meir Statman shares his insights on the broader aspects of financial well-being and its interconnection with life satisfaction.

item.title: Aston Martin's first quarter earnings drop 34% as it awaits fourth CEO in four years
item.description: The luxury carmaker shipped 945 vehicles in the period, a 26% decline from the prior year, while revenue dropped 10% to $334 million.

item.title: Book Review: Trailblazers, Heroes, and Crooks
item.description: Stephen Foerster, CFA, extracts lessons from exceptional episodes in financial history that ordinary investors and seasoned professionals alike can put to profitable use. The bonus is that you'll be entertained from start to finish.

item.title: Novo Nordisk's market value of $570 billion is now bigger than the entire Danish economy—creating a 'Nokia risk' for Denmark
item.description: “When you have superpowers, you have super responsibility," says CEO Lars Fruergaard Jorgensen.

item.title: What Price Risk? Unpacking the Equity Risk Premium
item.description: Stocks are a good wager over the long term, on favorable odds. But stocks remain a bet, and investors must grasp how much returns can vary over long time horizons.

item.title: Geely-backed Polestar pushes back results for second time in a year, as the Swedish carmaker battles accounting errors
item.description: The EV maker is relying on new models such as the Polestar 4 coupe to bolster sales.
